main event: An unidentified silver object, the size of a pin head, was observed slowly fading from sight in a northwesterly direction over the course of 5 hours on October 21, 1959 in Olcott, New York.
interesting points: The object appeared to be a reflection from the sun, as if from a mirror.
The object was observed at an angle of about 10 degrees west from directly overhead.
The object's motion was described as stationary to slow, moving in a direct path gradually to the northwest.
An F-102 aircraft was vectored to the area but did not sight the object. A C-45 aircraft was observed in the area, and a weather balloon release and deflation was also reported.
The Air Force concluded that the sighting was possibly caused by a sharp temperature inversion leading to light reflections, and that no physical evidence existed.
sighted object: A silver, pin-head sized object reflecting sunlight like a mirror
